title: Lesson Trailer: "Females Singing to be Heard"
lessonRelevance: A brief overview of the lesson, providing broader context from two authors of the study this lesson is based on.

title: How to solve the Polymath Puzzle from the "Females Sing" lesson
lessonRelevance: Explains strategies for solving the Polymath Puzzle. This is an engagement hook that blends a simple alphabetic shift puzzle with a data literacy challenge.

title: How to read the deciphered scatter plot
lessonRelevance: Provides scaffolding for understanding how to read this graph (which comes straight from a recent study) and notice patterns.

title: Polymath Puzzle Revealâ€”Is the graph about birds, spiders, whales,...?
lessonRelevance: Explains what this graph is actually about, providing background on female song in barn swallows and the field work employed to study it.

title: Scatter plots or histograms? Why data visualization is important
lessonRelevance: Highlights the vital importance of data literacy. It asks students to think critically about the pros and cons of scatter plots and histograms.

title: Connections between dot plots and histograms (with sound)
lessonRelevance: Show logical connections between a dot plot, a binned dot plot, and a histogram. The silly sounds are added for memorability.

title: Getting to know your data: Counting barn swallow songs
lessonRelevance: This video demonstrates how to count barn swallow songs to generate the data examined.

title: Scientific Background: Female barn swallows sing
lessonRelevance: This video is not included in the lesson, but is provided for your background or if you want to use it in some way.
